revised_title: On the Formation of a Heat-Reversible Gel
tldr: The author investigates the formation of a heat-reversible gel using a substance called 5-dimethylaminoanilo-3:4 diphenylcyclopentene-1:2 dione, also known as azomethine. The gel can be formed in various solvents and is unique in its ability to convert into a gel directly with any solvent. The gel is labile to crystals and liquefies upon standing, with the presence of water stabilizing the gel state.
